Pausing at an intersection in a quiet, working-class suburban street, a spherical glass object suddenly falls from the sky and lands with a deafening crash on the roadway, several yards in front of his idling car. Truman is suddenly aware that the hundreds of other beachgoers have stopped their activities to stare at him. YOUTH 1 (shrugs, suddenly more couth) Physical violence paralyzes him. As Truman pulls away from the curb, she is already removing the lavender cardigan from the drycleaning bag on the back seat. MERYL (suddenly exasperated) Oh. Truman, spellbound by the man, suddenly wheels around to face him. A bus suddenly screeches to a halt beside the struggling group, doors already open, and before Truman can react, the Old Woman and the Young Executive force the Homeless Man onto the bus.
